{"step_by_step_thinking": "A diastema is a gap between two teeth, often the front teeth. This can be caused by a thick labial frenum, which is the tissue connecting the lip to the gums. A frenectomy is a procedure to remove or alter this tissue. The treatment of diastema due to a thick labial frenum is typically done after a frenectomy. This is because the frenectomy can help to eliminate the cause of the diastema, allowing for more effective treatment of the gap.", "answer_choice": "A. After frenectomy"}
